programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: The Alaskans prepare for trapping season. Heimos newest cabin may have fallen victim to a marauding bear. Meanwhile, Tyler and Ashley step up their house build.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: The team at Irelands only seal rescue centre recount their most amazing rescues. Egg was two months old when she had a flipper amputated.

programme.title: Dogs: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Journey around the world and discover how dogs became one of the most valued animals on the planet. From wild predators to friendly pets- this is the story of mans best friend.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Brown children face a big decision as they leave the Alaskan homestead. Ami prepares for her cancer treatment in California, and the family try to keep spirits up.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: As Ami prepares to undergo treatment for lung cancer, Bear, Bird, and Rain work to give the familys homestead back to the bush- and the wolfpack looks to the future.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: A game of underwater copycat shows how dolphins are some of the animal kingdoms smartest creatures. The secrets behind a geckos incredible and unique feet are revealed, and experts explain how leeches suck blood.

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Are alligators music lovers? How a squirrel can hide up to 10,000 nuts in one season and still find most of them? And, can a bug survive in space?

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: After a midnight call out the crew are shocked to find a grim menagerie of hundreds of birds, roosters and dogs. Have they been bred for fighting?

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Animal Cops come to the rescue of a desperate cat stuck down a drain deep underground. Plus, they help an abandoned dog in danger of freezing to death.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: Animal Cops discover a Doberman in an alarming state; its claws are so long theyve grown into the pads of its feet. The dog is rescued but can its leg be saved?

programme.title: Life at Vet University
programme.desc: Fourth year student Clint assists in an emergency C-section on a Cocker Spaniel, only to discover that the newborn puppy may not make it.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: Bradley and Billy are in southern California to find a super predator, the sugar glider. These marsupials are the dominant predator for their size.

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The guys are in Mpumalanga, South Africa, searching for the Cape mole-rat. They have giant, razor-sharp teeth, and are known as the king of the underground.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: An adventurous puppy falls off a trampoline, can Dr. Jeff and Petra mend its broken leg? Meanwhile, Susan takes care of a litter of kittens and their mum.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Tigger the cat is monitored closely for unusual eating habits. Plus, Dr. Jeff cautions an owner of the perils of buying online when she brings in her unwell puppy.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: After historical wildfires strike Australia, the Irwins race to rescue as many animals as possible. Robert and Terri help the severely injured koala population.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: After the birth of Talbert the giraffe, serious complications arise. Plus, Robert rescues an entangled swan caught in a fishing line.

programme.title: The Aquarium
programme.desc: Nandi, the aquariums smallest manta ray, is due her annual check up and some young ruddy ducks arrive at the aquarium and are introduced to their new habitat.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Villalobos faces one of their most challenging rescues when a house fire reveals a massive dog-hoarding situation. Two teachers fall in love with a deaf puppy.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson works with a couple whose lovable cat, Zachary, sprays all over the house. Plus, he meets up with troublemaking cat named Freddie Krueger.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio and the team make a mountain cabin safer for Chickie, a blind senior dog. Plus, they build a Japanese-inspired indoor dog lounge.

programme.title: Animal Cribs
programme.desc: Antonio transforms the home of a couple who run a parrot sanctuary, housing 23 birds. The team creates a new outdoor aviary to allow the birds to fly free.

programme.title: Extinct Or Alive
programme.desc: Forrest is in the Faroe Islands looking for a trace of the great auk, a large flightless seabird that was declared extinct over 175 years ago.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Brittany Kerr, wife of country superstar Jason Aldean, wants Wayde and Brett to surprise her husband with a fish tank.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NBA superstar Anthony Davis brings Wayde and Brett on board to transform an entire room into an aquarium! Will they be able to deliver a winning tank?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: NFL superstar, Antonio Brown, thinks a fish tank will get him to this years Super Bowl. ATM must impress with a huge aquarium and an end zone dance!

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: The struggle for food, water and warmth continues as Tim heads into the harsh and freezing Wrangell Mountains to hunt mountain goats.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: When Theodore a four year old Maltese Terrier is brought into the vet hospital with a mystery illness, the vets struggle for a diagnosis as his condition gets worse.

programme.title: Saved By The Barn
programme.desc: Dwight the cow is taken to Indiana to receive hydrotherapy. Meanwhile, Dan welcomes over a dozen exotic farm animals and Lola the goat is ready to walk again!

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: Winter is fast approaching, and moose-hunting season begins. Tyler stalks an elusive bull, while Charlie gets a taste of why the region is known as starvation country.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: The Sheldrick Wildlife Trust rescue baby animals in Kenya. They saved elephant Malkia when she was six months old. Now shes ready to go back into the wild.

programme.title: Bad Dog
programme.desc: Monkey Boo has free reign of the house and his owners heart and Duke, a Labradoodle, is obsessed with getting into anything that might contain food.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns try to adapt after closing their dream homestead. They face a new start with the skills and knowledge from over 35 years in the Alaskan wilderness.

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The Browns embark on a quest to discover new land that steers them into unfamiliar terrain. There, they pledge to rebuild a life of independence in the bush.

programme.title: Fish Or Die
programme.desc: The guys are in Borneo, looking for a fish close to extinction - the mahseer. To find it, they risk entering the territory of the headhunting Dayak people.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: The Irwins return to the Steve Irwin Wildlife Reserve to study crocodiles. It’s an epic trip as Robert leads the croc catching team for the very first time, while Bindi and Chandler reveal a life-changing announcement.

programme.title: Big Cat Tales
programme.desc: A dispersed Marsh Pride faces weakened protection from the six male warrior lions. Plus, a cheetah works tirelessly to raise her three new cubs.

programme.desc: Shaun heads out on a solo night mission to rescue a cat thats been missing for 3 weeks. Plus, in Bonney Lake, Tom and Shaun attempt to rescue a feral cat.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue

programme.title: I Was Prey
programme.desc: On a camping trip in Canada, 12-year-old Zac Delventhal is dragged from his tent by a wolf. Plus, Maria Korcsmaros is attacked by a great white in the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Shaun is called out to Covington and braves wet conditions to bring down a friendly stray that obviously misses his home.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun travels to La Conner to rescue Play-Play, whose distraught owner watches nearly 70 feet below. Meanwhile, Tom is called out on a late night mission.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Marlynn Barkley tries to save a dog that has been left for dead by its owners. Later, she makes an emergency dash to the hospital.

programme.title: Premier de corvee
programme.desc: Malgre deux emplois dans la restauration et la livraison, la vie hors des radars dun travailleur clandestin malien. Un documentaire qui raconte par lexemple les luttes des sans-papiers en France, estimes à près de 700 000, pour de meilleures conditions dexistence.

programme.title: Sans-Souci, le palais de Frederic le Grand
programme.desc: Cœur de la Prusse sous Frederic le Grand, le somptueux palais de Sans-Souci a accueilli les penseurs des Lumières, dont Voltaire, et des artistes de renom. Visite guidee dune œuvre dart totale, imaginee par un monarque au pouvoir absolu, philosophe mais aussi redoutable chef de guerre.

programme.title: Medecines dailleurs
programme.desc: Aux Philippines, le "hilot", tradition medicale ancienne, passe par le toucher. Ceux qui pratiquent ce massage, les "manghihilot", ont pour seuls outils leurs mains et de l’huile de noix de coco. Bernard Fontanille rencontre Angelita Calderon, une femme qui soigne les gens du village et les agriculteurs grâce à ses manipulations et sa maîtrise des points de pression.

programme.title: Medecines dailleurs
programme.desc: À La Reunion, les tizanèrs, ces herboristes guerisseurs, incarnent une medecine nourrie d’un lien à la nature.

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Au cours de sa vie, l’etre humain passe jusqu’à six annees à rever. Et si les reves etaient plus que des visions irreelles ? Si nous arrivions à transposer dans la realite les idees geniales apparues en songe ? Les reves recèlent un potentiel creatif largement inexploite à ce jour. Alors, faut-il rever davantage ? Et mieux tirer profit de notre activite onirique ?

programme.title: Crèches, razzia sur les bebes
programme.desc: Depuis l’ouverture des crèches au secteur prive, au debut des annees 2000, la petite enfance fait l’objet d’un juteux business pour ses acteurs voraces. Alors que les scandales de maltraitance et de detournement dargent public se multiplient, enquete sur les derives dune deregulation, qui a transforme les bebes en machines à cash.

programme.title: Crèches, razzia sur les bebes
programme.desc: Après vingt ans de deregulation liberale, de scandales de maltraitance et de detournement dargent public, des gouvernements et des municipalites de plusieurs pays d’Europe tentent de reprendre la main sur le secteur des crèches privees.

programme.title: ARTE Junior, le mag
programme.desc: Des personnes malentendantes ou sourdes, mais aussi celles à louïe parfaite peuvent communiquer merveilleusement grâce à des mouvements des doigts et des mains, ce quon appelle le language des signes. Chaque langue parlee a sa propre langue des signes. On vous explique tout ça dans nos questions reponses avec des elèves de CM1 !

programme.title: 42 - La reponse à presque tout
programme.desc: Aujourdhui, le feu est devenu synonyme de destruction, avec des incendies de plus en plus ravageurs emettant denormes quantites de CO2. De quoi accelerer le derèglement climatique qui, à son tour, favorise les departs de feu. Un cercle vicieux qui a pousse les chercheurs à qualifier notre epoque de "pyrocène".

programme.title: Les bars les plus design dans le monde
programme.desc: DOslo à Tokyo en passant par Johannesburg, des bars et restaurants repensent la convivialite, entre design atypique et atmosphère soignee. Dans cet episode : un bar cache sous un pont de Berlin, un club viennois installe dans la cave de Freud et un rooftop à Bangkok.

programme.title: Twist
programme.desc: La jeunesse eternelle : un reve aussi vieux que l’humanite. Naguère lubie de milliardaires californiens, la course à la longevite est desormais une tendance mondiale. Mais peut-on vraiment retarder l’ineluctable ? À quel prix ? Et comment vieillir heureux ? "Twist" part à la rencontre d’artistes et d’intellectuels qui portent chacun un regard different sur le vieillissement.

programme.title: Les nonnes kung-fu : bouddhistes et feministes
programme.desc: Arts martiaux, spiritualite et emancipation feminine : dans un monastère situe sur les hauteurs de Katmandou, une communaute de nonnes est de tous les combats.

programme.title: Cuisines des terroirs
programme.desc: Sur le plateau du Karst, non loin de Trieste, la diversite culturelle s’apprecie jusque dans l’assiette...

programme.title: Les parcs naturels portugais
programme.desc: Tour d’horizon des parcs naturels du Portugal. Dans ce volet : Sintra-Cascais, près de Lisbonne, mele plages idylliques, falaises abruptes et forets brumeuses. Surnommee la "riviera portugaise", la region abrite l’immense dune de Cresmina, en constant mouvement. Menaces par les incendies, les habitants tentent de restaurer les forets et de preserver la biodiversite.

programme.title: Les parcs naturels portugais
programme.desc: Tour d’horizon des parcs naturels du Portugal. Dans ce volet : à quelques kilomètres de la côte atlantique, le parc des Serras de Aire et Candeeiros cache sous ses plateaux arides un immense reseau de cavernes et de grottes. Ce massif calcaire, le plus vaste du pays, recèle des formations spectaculaires et joue un rôle essentiel dans le stockage des eaux souterraines.

programme.title: Les parcs naturels portugais
programme.desc: Tour d’horizon des parcs naturels du Portugal. Dans ce volet : au nord-est du pays, le parc international du Douro seduit par ses gorges spectaculaires et ses falaises abruptes, refuge de plus de 170 espèces d’oiseaux. Berceau de la plus ancienne region viticole du monde, sa vallee abrite des vignobles en terrasses façonnes par des millenaires de traditions.

programme.title: Quand lhistoire fait dates
programme.desc: En denonçant l’invasion de son pays par l’Italie à la tribune de la Societe des nations, le negus d’Éthiopie vient rappeler aux nations leurs engagements et leurs devoirs, au regard du droit international. Mais le cynisme des grandes puissances fait de la crise ethiopienne le laboratoire des renoncements politiques conduisant au pire. Comment enrayer la mecanique ineluctable qui mène à la guerre ?

programme.title: Laigle sest envole
programme.desc: Un commando nazi est charge denlever Winston Churchill. Avec Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland et Robert Duvall.

programme.title: Secrets sauvages du patrimoine
programme.desc: Plante sur un piton rocheux depuis le XIIe siècle, le château du Haut-Kœnigsbourg, en Alsace, a ete le temoin des conflits et des rivalites entre seigneurs, rois et empereurs qui ont emaille cette region tour à tour germanique et française. Ceux qui ont bâti la forteresse, aujourdhui visitee par des milliers de touristes, ont aussi façonne le paysage qui lentoure.

programme.title: Les Alpes bavaroises
programme.desc: Ponctue de nombreuses montagnes et lacs, le pays alpin bavarois jouit d’une image preservee. Pourtant, au cours des dernières decennies, la flore et la faune y ont considerablement souffert de l’exploitation intensive des terres agricoles. Pour tenter d’inverser la tendance, plusieurs initiatives voient desormais le jour.

programme.title: La "folie" de Louis II : Neuschwanstein, le château enchante
programme.desc: Entre genie architectural et feerie kitsch, le château de Neuschwanstein est intimement lie au destin tragique de Louis II de Bavière (1845-1886), le "roi fou". Retour sur l’histoire d’un edifice peuple de reves et de legendes.

programme.title: Golda Schultz, Rolando Villazon et Ludovic Tezier - Château de Neuschwanstein 2025
programme.desc: La Deutsche Kammerphilharmonie de Breme sous la baguette d’Omer Meir Wellber investit le château de Neuschwanstein, dans le sud de l’Allemagne, pour un concert lyrique avec la soprano Golda Schultz, le tenor Rolando Villazon et le baryton Ludovic Tezier. Dans cet edifice grandiose construit par Louis II de Bavière, le prestigieux trio interprète Rossini et Mozart.

programme.title: Karambolage
programme.desc: Voilà un temps fou que notre journaliste allemand Hajo Kruse tenait absolument à presenter à ses compatriotes le mot le plus celèbre de la langue française : merde - Nikola Obermann nous emmène en cuisine pour nous presenter la crème de la crème : la crème fouettee.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: Colette, linsoumise
programme.desc: Avec une fantaisie très Belle Époque, ce documentaire retrace la vie libre et theâtrale de Colette, immense ecrivaine et insatiable hedoniste.

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: True Grit est une histoire de vengeance et de courage se passant sur limpitoyable et imprevisible frontière de lOuest americain où la justice est simple et la misericorde est rare. Mattie Ross, est determinee à venger le sang de son père en capturant Tom Chaney, lhomme qui la tue pour deux pièces dor. A tout juste quatorze ans, elle engage Rooster Cogburn , un US Marshall alcoolique pour l’aider à traquer le tueur de son père.

programme.title: Jeff Bridges, star malgre lui
programme.desc: Il a fui les feux de la rampe, avant que "The Dude", figure culte de "The Big Lebowski" des frères Coen, ne le propulse star. Portrait de Jeff Bridges, artiste aux multiples talents et grand acteur en marge des profils hollywoodiens.

programme.title: Penissimo
programme.desc: À la memoire de Jad Turjman Du dieu Priape à la circoncision, en passant par l’extreme virilite incarnee par Schwarzenegger ou Stallone, un drôle de voyage culturel à travers l’histoire du penis, invitant à remettre en question la masculinite contemporaine.

programme.title: Stjepan Hauser joue Bach et Morricone - Château de Neuschwanstein 2025
programme.desc: Au château de Neuschwanstein, en Allemagne, le violoncelliste croate Stjepan Hauser mele les genres aux côtes de l’Orchestre philharmonique de Munich, dirige par le maestro Ulf Schirmer. Le soliste interprète le celèbre "Air sur la corde de sol" de Bach, le thème du "Parrain", signe Ennio Morricone, et la musique de la serie "Game of Thrones", composee par Ramin Djawadi.

programme.title: Le Teatro Amazonas
programme.desc: Inaugure en 1896, lemblematique opera de Manaus en pleine foret amazonienne, dont la construction a repose sur des annees dexploitation des populations indigènes, permet daborder la situation sociale, culturelle et politique du Bresil. À travers les preparatifs de "Peter Grimes" de Benjamin Britten, ce documentaire montre aussi comment le Teatro Amazonas et la musique font vivre Manaus.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: With spring in full effect across the Arctic, residents of Alaska must seize seasonal opportunities. Sue Aikens sets out to hunt small game but must be wary of her recent surgery.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The 12 remaining contenders face three tasks designed to test their bread-making skills, beginning by making 36 perfectly thin and crispy bread sticks. For the technical challenge they have to prepare a batch of English muffins, before ending with show-stopping loaves - from a Christmas wreath to a proud peacock. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present, with Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry judging the contenders efforts.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Its round three, and the heat in the kitchen is rising with a burglary in the Bake Off tent, as the remaining 11 bakers get ready to deal with desserts.

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood assess how the remaining contestants cope with making pies and tarts. They begin with signature double-crusted fruit pies, make custard tarts in the technical challenge and finish by creating pies made with filo pastry for the showstopper. Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins present.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The presenter of TV holiday series Hot Shots takes a midnight swim, only for her body to be washed up on the shore. Initial evidence points towards accidental drowning, but Jack is troubled by marks on the victims neck - and as he questions her colleagues, a secret affair, unrequited love and rocky working relationships convince the DI that this was no accident. With Florence away on a romantic weekend, JP steps up to help the DI with the case, and with the tourist board up in arms about the crime, Commissioner Selwyn keeps a close eye on the investigation

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: In the wake of his fathers death, Benedict Dacre rules the roost at the Paradise Skies Coffee plantation - but all is not plain sailing. Soon after he breaks the news to his family that it is time for them to move on and sell the plantation, Benedict is found murdered. DI Jack Mooney and the team must navigate the tempestuous waters of a family divided. Elsewhere Ruby is settling in well and reveals to JP that she was once arrested, much to his horror. Has she put her own job at risk?

programme.title: Death in Paradise

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti. Joanna kicks off her adventure in the back of a classic car in Havana, outlining her 1500-mile Caribbean adventure.

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining teams bake two dozen gateaux Basques and tartes Tatin, before reinventing teatime classic the Battenberg Cake - where only the extraordinary will do.

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: Mistaking Prince Ivandoe for a lowly peasant, Rabbit Hood bestows upon him precious jewellery - that she has stolen from a Prince. Prince Svan to be precise! Who is none too pleased to discover his precious items in Ivandoe’s possession! Ivandoe and Bert evade capture and set off on a quest to find Rabbit Hood. They must persuade her to return Svan’s treasures, thereby clearing Ivandoe’s princely name.

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: A Hooded Stranger from Prince Ivandoe’s past seeks revenge, by attempting to ruin Ivandoe’s perfect princely appearance.

programme.desc: When Mom and Dad struggle to keep hyperactive toddler-aged Gumball from trashing the house and exhausting them they decide to buy him a pet.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Via the sewers, Darwin finds himself flushed out to sea. He is terrified but determined to make his way back to the Wattersons. However, a fish can’t get very far on land so Darwin will have to do millions of years of evolution in a matter of hours if he’s going to get home safe and sound.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Alan ditches Gumball to do something more fun, Gumball is desperate to track him down and make him pay for his betrayal.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball develops a strange stutter and it makes him accidentally offend Darwin. When Darwin asks for his advice on hats Gumball suddenly can’t speak and offends Darwin. Darwin is convinced Gumball said he had a fat head. But when Gumball tries to correct him his speech and movement all start going wrong at the same time. He soon realises that he may not be the only one in Elmore having communication problems…

programme.title: Jade Armor
programme.desc: When L.J. learns she’s Jade, a Shard in the Clock Tower keeps her reliving the same day. To stop the loop, she must activate her Armor and absorb the Shard! Can the Beasticons convince her to take up the mantle in time to save ALL TIME?

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: Prince Ivandoe escorts his spoilt cousin Dudley to "Unruly School," run by the scarily strict governess Posy Pippins. But Ivandoe falls under Dudleys influence and misbehaves so much Posy wont let him leave.

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: When the legendary Mighty Stallion “out-hero’s” Prince Ivandoe, by saving the Bunny Village from a terrifying beastie, Ivandoe loses his confidence. Even though the Stallion demands payments in carrots, which is in direct violation of the Hero Code, Ivandoe feels he cannot compete with such a magnificent fellow. Bert must help his master find his mojo again, before the Bunny Village is destroyed by an even bigger terrifying beastie!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball is embarrassed when Mum comes to school to spend some “quality time”.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Enter Gumballs world, where 2D and 3D combine and he and his friend, Darwin, embark on insanely funny, everyday adventures.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Anais is convinced that Gumball is being bullied by Tina Rex.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball is desperate to avoid a late fee on the rented dvd he accidentally destroyed.

programme.title: Totally Spies!
programme.desc: When waves start rolling upside down, the spies discover someone is messing with the moon and turning it into cheese! They track the villain to Paris and the Eiffel Tower, where they have the cheesiest fight of their lives!

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: When Rocky suggests the Elmore Junior High kids skip school the bus is boarded by criminals who seem to want to teach them the importance of school attendance. The masked culprits are clearly the childrens parents faking a heist to teach them a lesson. But when the police get involved for real it becomes clear the parents arent the ones pulling the strings.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Ever wondered what the people of Elmore dream about? As night falls in Elmore the Moon takes us on a tour through the various dreams - and nightmares - of the inhabitants. / Gumball is late to meet Penny at the mall, but a series of misunderstandings on the way only delay him further.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: The Wattersons try and reconnect Darwin to his fish roots. When Mom sees Darwin gazing longingly at a fish-tank she thinks their mammalian lifestyle isn’t fulfilling her adopted son and deep down he longs to connect with his fishy roots. So the family try to re-connect him with his aquatic culture; they try fish-food fish-language even fish clothes. But when none of it works they realize they may have to let him go.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have unearthed a box filled with birthday fountains of light that spit forth giant bursts of sparks.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger accidentally backs her car over Butchs tail. Feeling awful, she brings the alley cat into her home until hes feeling better. Butch is finally getting what hes wanted, much to Toms chagrin, especially now that Gingers having him take care of the poor injured cat. Jerry revels in the situation until he realizes that two idiot cats are more trouble than one and Jerrys getting his butt whooped. Now Jerry must prove that Butch is rehabilitated in order to return him to the alley where he belongs and return his life.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Hildie is mixing a batch of foot balm thatll soften and beautify her gnarly-looking feet. She has Tom rub it in, nice and good. Unfortunately, the foot balm is a little too strong and makes her foot disappear. Hildies recipe may be a foot balm bomb but it gives Tom a good idea. Hell use it to "vanish" into thin air. Jerry literally doesnt know what hit him when the invisible cat bats him around like a ball of yarn. Tom is unaware when the effects begin to wear off and Jerry is able to defend himself. When Jerry gets a hold of the cream, its his turn to have the upper hand. A battle of the vanishing cream ensues, each using it in various ways to outwit the other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its Toms wedding day! Hes getting married to Toodles in a backyard wedding that were experiencing through the eyes of his best friend, Jerry. Puuuuurfeeecttt in every way, then the crap hits the mouse hole: Tom is given Jerry as a wedding gift. When it cant possibly get worse Jerry wakes up and tosses Toodles out of the house!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry is left alone in an empty house after Rick, Ginger and Tom are nowhere to be seen.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry brings Tom to consciousness. His partner has an aluminum bat on his head, arrow in his butt, bee stings on his arm, tire treads on his back, lipstick on his cheek and a terrible case of amnesia. Jerry must help Tom use the investigative clues on his body to solve what happened. The clues will take them to some destinations that may leave Tom more physically abused than when he started but in better mental shape (as each stop causes a little more memory to return).

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: We open on a SOLD sign in front of what will be Rick and Gingers house. Inside, the house is empty – no Rick, no Ginger, no Tom, no furniture. Just Jerry, who slip slides merrily across the bare floors – the place all to himself. That is until the front door opens and Rick and Ginger arrive in their new home. Ginger screams having just seen a mouse and tells Rick to get Tom out of the moving van. Like most cats in a new place, Tom doesnt want to come out from beneath the recently placed couch, but Ginger demands he catch that mouse! And so we watch the beginning of a lifelong adversarial relationship unfold one gag at a time!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is bothered by an object stuck in between the sofa cushions: a big fur lemming puppet glove.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry are in the middle of it when Tom hears someone singing the tale of a cat who met his unfortunate, painful end chasing a much superior opponent. The song is about underestimating your opponent. Every time Tom stops chasing Jerry, the music stops. When Tom resumes, the music resumes. This back and forth continues until the chase takes Tom right past a Singing Uncle Pecos. Tom skids to a stop causing Uncle Pecos to stop singing. Tom wants to prove the lyrics of Uncle Pecos song wrong, but in the end, Toms ego proves to everyone, including himself, that he is very much the subject of Uncle Pecos cautionary tale.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: After another attempt on Jerrys part to elude Tom, Jerry overhears Rick and Ginger talk about the possibility of getting rid of that "useless cat." When Ginger sounds like shes considering the possibility, Jerry cant believe his ears!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Spike hasnt been the best role model for his boy when it comes to being a good sport. You could even say Spikes a sore loser. Thats why Spike recruits Tom and Jerry to help teach the little guy how to lose gracefully. When Tom beats Tyke at a game of tic-tac-toe Tyke puts the "sore" into "sore loser" by biting Toms finger when Tom extends it for a friendly post-game handshake. Tom forces Jerry to take turns playing various games with Tyke (e.g. Checkers, basketball, hopscotch, etc…). Each time they win, Tyke takes it out on them. When Tom and Jerry start throwing the games, Spikes right there to dole out his own punishment for letting Tyke win. Sometimes you just cant win!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tuffy and Jerry are brushing their teeth. Tuffys so tired he uses Jerrys tail instead of his toothbrush. They climb in their respective beds, only Tuffys not in his bed, hes in the palm of Toms hand that Toms made-up to look like a bed. Tom gets walloped for his little stunt but it points out to Jerry that he needs a safer home. What begins with Jerry securing his home from Tom, turns into an arms race between the cat and mouse where they each build their own booby-trapped bunker to protect themselves from each other. They turn out to be their own greatest enemy, with the biggest threat coming from their own creations. In the end, they go back to their relatively safer existence.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: While using a wand to make inanimate objects come to life to attack Jerry, Tom accidentally zaps a marionette (Marie Antoin-marionette). Now the cat and mouse have more on their hands than either one of them can handle! Sure the marionette pulls Hildie and Beaties heart-strings when they are around (both are thrilled to have another girl in the house even if she is made of wood), but the doll delights in getting Tom into trouble when the witch sisters arent looking. When Marie becomes too much for even Jerry to bear, Tom and Jerry have to figure out how to get rid of the little hellion! They brought her into this world, now theyve got to take her out!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its summer, and Spikes the primary beneficiary of Ricks daily grilling ritual: the pooch is tossed a nice juicy T-bone nightly. When Spike gets stuck trying to exit the doghouse, he realizes its time to back off the beef.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a robot to clean his flat but it ends up trashing half the town.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants an ice cream from the ice cream van but ends up serving himself – along with every kid in town.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is feeling very left out when he discovers that Mrs Wicket is having a huge party downstairs and apparently he isn’t invited. Bean tries every trick in the book to sneak himself into the party – even resorting to hiding inside an enormous cake. If only he knew the real reason for the celebration.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean digs a hole in his garden - and finds a bomb!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidentally swaps trunks with a magician with magical results!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean doesn’t like sharing the local soft play centre with a load of rowdy kids – so he goes home and builds his own house of fun.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean’s pizzas are a huge success with everyone – well almost everyone.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs a new passport photograph and goes to incredible lengths to get one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless hero visits the Science Museum, where he makes a new friend with a bagful of gadgets.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean cannot, for the life of him, place the face of the uninvited fat bloke on his doorstep. An old school photograph and school cap just about jog his memory. By this time his new ‘friend’ has put his feet up and is eating Bean out of house and home. This blast from the past proves to be a blasted pain in the neck.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Boss shows he’s still got it in the inventin’ department by coming up with a brain-swapping raygun. Just what the world needs. The Boss’ glory is short lived, though, when the raygun starts going off randomly. The Boss and Lamput trade places, and we get to see what it looks like when the worst boss in the world can also freak you out by morphing into orange stuff. Everyone’s acting topsy turvy, so it’s up to Specs and Skinny to straighten things out. Lucky those guys don’t have brains to swap.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: The Docs spot Lamput in the audience of a magic show and try to catch him. The chase takes them backstage where Lamput evades the Docs with the help of different magic contraptions until Specs and Skinny unknowingly ends up on stage. They become reluctant assistants to the Magician who is about to perform some death-defying tricks – with the help of the Docs!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: While trying to escape from the Docs, Lamput stumbles into a hole in the ground, which leads in an underground civilization with a large tribe in it! Lamput gets misunderstood as the Chosen One according to the tribe’s prophecy. The tribe hails Lamput as the prophet and this proves to be a huge challenge for the Docs to catch Lamput, now that Lamput is surrounded by worshippers and guards at all times!

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders try to help Winston Whale by building him a mail truck, but Winston is used to working alone.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a lighthouse for Looneyburg, Lola’s tablet breaks and she must rely on herself.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Lola leads the crew in washing their vehicles only to discover she mixed up the job assignments.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Poison Ivy uses a rare pollen-spewing flower to put all of Gotham to sleep, its up to Bibi to save her friends and save the day.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi has some competition with Nightwing’s motorcycle, Nightbike. These stunt bikes will need to learn that they’re better when they work together.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang travels to Britain in 1843-ish and runs into Scrooge who claims he was attacked by the ghost of his partner Jacob Marley and that three more ghosts are coming. The gang agrees to solve the mystery but Velma wonders if she has more potential than just solving mysteries.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: A very bad parking choice on Freds part leads the gang to an asteroid mining base in outer space where an alien virus appears to be infecting the crew one by one, turning them into evil skull-headed aliens. The paranoid, terrified gang must try to solve the mystery before the virus reaches them, as well – if it hasnt already!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. Not to be deterred, Mr Bean tries everything he can to distract the guard to have his go on the ride. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean spots a rare book - the Teddy Bear Haunting - in a bookshop, but it’s too expensive to buy. He secretly tries to read it in the shop… until he’s thrown out. To his dismay someone else then buys the book – so he follows the buyer around trying to read over his shoulder. Will Mr Bean manage to get to the end of the book before getting spotted?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are enjoying a day at the arcade, when Mr Bean gets carried away with the dance machine, knocking Teddy onto the floor. Teddy’s picked up, put on a trolley of stuffed toys and figurines – and soon enough, he’s been put in the claw machine as a prize! Mr Bean has run out of coins, so has to find a way of winning Teddy back without looking like he’s cheating!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean and Teddy are looking forward to seeing a once-in-a-lifetime comet – but it won’t appear until 4am! He tries to stay up, but it’s useless – he keeps dropping off. So instead, Mr Bean decides to go to bed and set an alarm – yet he over-winds the clock and it breaks! With all the shops closed, his only option is to build his own complicated version to make sure he doesn’t miss the comet…

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket makes Mr Bean drive her to the hospital to get her ingrown toenail seen to and asks him to wait. Mr Bean gets bored, and on a wander around the hospital he finds a spare doctor’s outfit with stethoscope – great Teddy - I’ll give you a check-up! But a nurse spots him, and thinking he’s a new doctor Mr Bean is asked to visit patients. How long can he keep it up before he’s found out?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean makes his own horror movie and ropes in Mrs Wicket as the star!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Determined to play the piano, Mr Bean finds a tune in his heart and sausages for fingers.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Its the start of a Fun Run. Mr. Bean lines-up beside his deadly enemy: the fat bloke who stole his parking space. Fun Run or no, nothing will stop Bean beating this man to the finishing post, even if he has to flag a cab.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: The Heroes must retrieve a Kazoom fragment before the Villains do.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang’s trip to be bayou is ruined by a shambling Swamp Beast that’s scaring away anyone who dares to enter it’s soggy domain!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang hits the ski slopes, but the fun is soon interrupted by the appearance of an evil Snowman Monster eager to scare all trespassers off his mountain.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput spends the day at the beach, and, in a pair of swimming trunks, cuts a fine figure indeed. That is to say; a small, round and blobby figure. It only takes one snide comment from a fellow beach-goer to bring Lamputs body issues to the surface. When youre a shape changer, though, theres no need for exercise; before long Lamput is strutting along as an orange amalgam of all the best-looking sunbakers. On the up side, its a handy disguise when the Docs come a-hunting. On the down side? Well, its kind of tiring pretending to be someone youre not. Lamput learns an important lesson from a nearby blobby little girl. Be yourself, and if anyones got a problem with that, they can go find their own patch of sand.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. Not to be deterred, Mr Bean tries everything he can to distract the guard to have his go on the ride. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean peers through the window of the opening party of an art exhibition and sees free snacks being handed around – yum! But he’s told by the bouncer that he needs to be smartly dressed. So he sneaks into the artist’s studio and paints a tuxedo onto himself. This time he’s let in, but will Bean’s fake painted suit last long enough for him to get his free food?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is trying to watch the motor racing on TV, when Mrs Wicket interrupts him to offer a deal – revamp her garden with new paving and ornaments, and he’ll get a month’s rent for free. Bean reluctantly agrees, but when he sees Mr Paliwal finish a personal training session and keen for more, he offers him a new workout… doing all Mr Bean’s work for him while he watches the racing! Win, win!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: In a trampoline park, Bean competes in a race with a boy. The winner gets Teddy. Will Bean and Teddy be separated forever?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Even for a giant seven foot bear, its not easy getting rid of pesky lemmings but its all fun seeing them constantly try to outsmart each other with cheeky plans.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to try out the brand new packaging format of chocolate spread that he discovers in the rangers cupboard: a yummy-looking XXL jar. And he does not intend to share it with the Lemmings. After observing a chameleon toad that is able to blend into its surroundings, the Lemmings decide to make themselves invisible to attain Grizzys treasure.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A magic tomahawk divides Grizzy into two identical bears with diametrically opposite personalities: one short-tempered, the other super-sweet. The Lemmings, who did not witness Grizzys split, will have a hard time working out the behavior of their usual enemy, who seems to swing from excessive kindness to the worst trickery for no reason.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: After studying a magazine advertisement with a couple standing in front of an SUV Grizzy imagines that if only he had a nice car his favorite she-bear would be

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While chasing the Lemmings Grizzy crashes into an arcade cabinet near the supermarket which displays a model fortuneteller and her crystal ball.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A newly unpacked UV tanning booth holds the place of honor in the middle of the cabin. Grizzy gets it into his head that a classy tan will help him draw the attention of the she-bear hes enamored with. When he opens the box, he discovers that the Lemmings have beat him to it and are already playing "beach party" inside the bed.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have turned the entire cabin topsy-turvy to organize medieval jousts with the rangers fencing gear. Grizzy, who wishes to recover his couch, tries to straighten up, but is driven out by their fencing foils. To retaliate, Grizzy must find a blade equal to the task. He opts for a fine... frozen swordfish!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird gets excited when he learns that Batman and Robin are taking him and Bam for a drive up the coast! But when the Joker and his van Prank show up unexpectedly and ruin Redbird’s beach day plans, Bam helps him realize that even though things didn’t go exactly as planned, they still had a great day!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After the Joker floods the Batcave, the Batwheels evacuate and relocate to a nearby parking garage.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Batman refuses to engage Joker in a race, Prank goads Bam into a rematch. Can Bam learn to not give in to the bullys dares and take the high road?

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After struggling to solve a riddle from Riddlers helicopter Quizz, Redbird must learn to speak up and share his ideas with the Batwheels.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a lighthouse for Looneyburg, Lola’s tablet breaks and she must rely on herself.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders redesign the final hole of ACME Acres Mini Golf Course, and Porky is determined to get it just right for the kids.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Beaver Brothers hire The Looney Builders to build them a log cabin, but soon sidetrack the job by goofing around too much.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders build a skate park for the kids, but it soon interferes with Hoots Talon and his friends’ activities.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Rick buys Ginger a brand new mattress with a lot of high tech features. Tom is under strict orders to never sleep on it, but Butch convinces him to try it out. Jerry uses the controls against them and soon that mattress is out of control and destroys the entire house.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry get a taste of the great outdoors on their camping trip to Yosemite. Tom tries hard to get some relaxation but nature and all its inhabitants, including bears, get in his way.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Tom and Jerry accidentally ruin Spikes birthday party for Tyke, he forces them to take over. They must entertain and take care of the puppy birthday bash, but no matter what they do, nothing seems to ever work out right.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Toodles hires Tom and Jerry to investigate and protect her against a threat to her tuna can inheritance, a mysterious figure keeps trying to hurt them as they investigate. They discover Butch was also hired by Toodles to protect the tuna. Spike, who was guarding the cans, is distracted by the fighting and leaves the cans unprotected. But could it be Toodles wasnt being completely honest with her story?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy have been practicing their rock-climbing skills, so that they can tackle the recently formed, huge crater on Saturn’s moon, Enceladus. Ella, however, prefers relying on her space boots to get her to the top of the rock wall

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: One little rock can cause a chain reaction by hitting bigger and bigger pieces. Ella inadvertently sends a rock on a collision course for Saturn’s moon, Prometheus. That’s where Ella’s dad has gone to work on a stalled vehicle.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: After hurting her leg, Ella has to take it easy for an entire day. Does she have the patience to sit and rest for that long?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitch’s arm shorts out, Ella’s dad has the right tools to fix him. While he’s at it, Dad shows off his latest creation, a Super Towing Arm. Slippy is impressed, and Glitch is more than happy to try it on for size!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is enlisted to pet sit Buttons, a friend’s dog, on the very day she has to finish a school project about Venus. She decides to take on both responsibilities at once by taking Buttons with her to the planet to capture the final piece of video footage she needs. When the thunder from the storms around Venus scare Buttons into accidentally detaching himself from his pod, he lands on the pla net and disappears. Ella and her friends search frantically on the hot planet but cannot find him. It’s Buttons who finds Ella! Ella admits she shouldn’t have taken her furry friend with her, but at least she learned new facts for her project!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad commissions a portrait of himself from Mrs. Otter but cant keep still enough for her to paint him. Will there ever be a portrait of Toad hanging in Toad Hall?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Toad throws out an old chair, he immediately regrets it but the Weasels have now claimed it. Can Toad and his friends persuade them to return it to him?

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Badger finds an old dirty painting of the Riverbankers’ ancestors as a choir and Ratty offers to put a new choir together. Chief and Tinker won’t let him Smudge join. Only a full restoration of the painting will reveal who really was in the The Wild Wood Warblers!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad volunteers to babysit Portly for the Otters only to find babysitting isn’t as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge normally hibernates but this year she is determined to see Christmas. Although she’s not much use in decoration preparation, she is able to bring peace and understanding to all when there is a dispute over the Christmas Tree.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has to replace his landlady’s cat after an unfortunate ‘accident’.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean builds a supermarket super trolley.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean gets in a complete flap when he befriends a feathered theif.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: When his landlady is involved in an accident, Mr Bean is left to care for her vicious cat Scrapper.

programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the worlds top stories as they happen.

programme.title: Biz Talk
programme.desc: A groundbreaking 30-minute interview show, giving an in-depth look into how top companies around the world conduct business and how policymakers view the fast-changing world economy. It presents 360 degree profiles of industry movers and shakers, tech mavericks and policymakers, and drills down on the stories behind their success, to give you clarity on what’s happening in every facet of business.

programme.title: The World Today
programme.desc: The World Today is the core rolling service of CGTN. keep viewers up-to-date with all the worlds top stories as they happen.

programme.title: The Agenda
programme.desc: A weekly talk-show looking beyond the headlines and “accepted wisdom” to find the real story. Hosted by award-winning journalist and presenter Stephen Cole, The Agenda quite simply sets The Agenda . You won’t find the same-old talking heads recycling platitudes; instead thought-provoking guests to debate and explore key issues of today’s world. Using virtual reality graphics to bring subjects to life, Stephen will navigate through subjects ranging from “Prove That Climate Change Exists” to “Who Will Win the Race to Space”. Opposing views will be given opportunity to flourish and develop into a meaningful conversation. The Agenda: No nonsense talk; Challenging perceptions.

programme.title: Expedition Unknown
programme.desc: Josh finds coins from an epic pirate treasure. He leaps into the frigid North Atlantic to recover the riches of feared pirate, Henry Avery.

programme.title: Mystery At Blind Frog Ranch
programme.desc: As the crew explore the cavern, they are overcome by a deadly and invisible gas cloud. Itll take a complicated rescue mission to get them out alive.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Salvage Dawgs save as much as they can from a burnt-down house in Mt Vernon, Ohio. In the shop, Mike builds a chair from a shopping cart.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Salvage Dawgs take on a Victorian house in Wellsville, Ohio. Key items salvaged include harlequin windows, corbels and front porch columns. Back at the shop, Mike and Tay build a wine rack from old brick moulds.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Dawgs stay in Roanoke to salvage an old diner sign. Back at the shop, the Whiteside family works together to build a clock from road signs.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Dawgs save pieces from the Roanoke Chamber of Commerce in Virginia, including safe deposit boxes and a pneumatic messaging system. The team also works on a large bar commissioned for the Natural Bridge Hotel.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: The development processed behind the creation of carbon fibre, railcar movers and hood ornaments. Plus, the techniques used in antique frame restoration.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Discover how sawhorses and toolboxes are manufactured and see how sorbet pops are mass-produced. Also, explore the construction behind school buses.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items go under the microscope with a look at how objects from sanders to solid terrain models are made.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Learn how everyday items such as pressed glass, pickup truck cabs, alpaca yarn and utility knives are produced.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike and Ant share their favourite moments from the series, revealing the hilarious outtakes, behind-the-scenes moments and private insights.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a rare beast: a 1976 Mercury Capri MK2 with the classic 2.8L V6. However, its not without its problems, which means a lot of work for Ant.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Metalworker Ted Edley is asked to restore an obscure German football table from the 1950s. Upholsterer Ray Clarke reimagines a stylish 1980s desk chair.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Dealer Saxon Durrant asks joiner Robin to give a 1930s kitchen cabinet a sleek transformation. Blacksmith Nev turns a fire grate into a modern piece of art.

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The baggage battlers head to a cowboy auction in California, where they duel over items dating back to the legendary Buffalo Bill and the Barnum And Bailey circuses.

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The baggage battlers head to a music icons auction in New York. They find a gold disc for the Pink Floyd album Dark Side Of The Moon and a nude photo of Madonna.

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The baggage battlers head to an auction in Denver, where they duel over a zebra rug. They also show an interest in some sealed lots, but will the contents be of value?

programme.title: Baggage Battles
programme.desc: The Baggage Battlers are heading to the Normandy where the largest private collection of military artefacts is being put up for sale. What will they manage to buy?

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete finds the perfect treehouse spot for a couple seeking a meditation space. 20-feet up, in a twisting pair of maples, the team creates an energy-infused retreat.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete is whipping up a stainless steel kitchen in the trees for a family of candy makers. This sweet treehouse has barrel ceilings and a loft bedroom.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Dawgs salvage a sign company in Roanoke, Virginia. They salvage metal lettering, copper cupolas, and vintage plumbing.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The team head back to Ellwood City to salvage the rectory of St. Agathas Catholic Church. The crew find a triple sink, glass blocks and storm door.

programme.title: Shed And Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove visit two amazing sets of sheds in Hampshire, where they find plenty of Japanese bikes - but they come away with a real surprise. Selling their projects on, however, proves to be a challenge.

programme.title: Shed And Buried
programme.desc: Henry and Sam are in the heart of Oxfordshire where they find rare Minis, 1970s Rollers, and a pristine rally car - but can they get her running?

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Natasha tasks Ted and Ruth with transforming a French Lily Chandelier; Martin gets to work on Drews Victorian fire bucket; and Saxon hands over a gargantuan estate wardrobe to Robin Johnson.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Upholsterer Craig tries to save a pair of sofas used in the Dr Who TV series. Plus, blacksmith Nev turns a pair of streetlamps into statement lights for the home.

programme.title: In The Eye Of The Storm
programme.desc: Hurricane Helene barrels north, causing massive flooding in Appalachia. As the deluge sweeps a woman away, a man jumps into the water to save her.

programme.title: Speed Cops
programme.desc: Road police on the hunt for posers and speeders all over Germany. The professionals know exactly whats impressive about cars - and whats illegal.

programme.title: The Autobahn A2
programme.desc: One of Europes busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people its their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: The Autobahn A2

programme.title: Crimes Gone Viral
programme.desc: An armed robber assaults a young woman, but she bravely fights back and fends off her attacker. A motorcycle ride turns into a violent road rage incident.

programme.title: Crimes Gone Viral
programme.desc: A strange man violently attempts to kidnap a womans children, but a young wrestler saves the day. A frightening robbery takes place in broad daylight.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: Parker Schnabel, Dave Turin and Fred Hurt reveal their gold mining origins and how a small remote corner of Southeast Alaska changed their destinies.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The miners reveal the secrets behind what it takes to strike it rich gold mining. From prospecting to the massive mining machinery, they hold nothing back.

programme.title: In The Eye Of The Storm

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The team heads to St. Michaels Catholic School in Pittsburgh. They brave high-wire heights in order to save elements of the past.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The team preserves a Greek revival farmhouse in Bentleyville. Main salvage items include mantels, tiles and a full-sized chicken coop.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The team heads to the Vaughan Furniture Company. Mike and Ted struggle to salvage a furniture press while Robert is slowed down by explosion-proof lights.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: The Salvage Dawgs head to Knoxville, Tennessee, in hopes of salvaging the crumbling Pickle Mansion. The main items of interest are a copper frieze and columns.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike is looking for a British classic and finds an XK8 Jaguar, but its not in good shape. Will Edd be able to fix it up within budget or is this project about to stall?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto expert Mike Brewer purchases a 1976 Porsche 911 Targa for £5,000 which he hands over to motor specialist Edd China to work his magic.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China completes the Porsche 911 Targa, refurbishing the gearbox, mending the roof seal and spraying it black. What price will Mike get for it?

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: How are channel signs are created, wetsuits are manufactured, and aluminium aircrafts made?

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they grow nearly 200,000 tonnes of mushrooms a year in the mushroom capital of the world? And, how do they make billions of life-saving gloves?

programme.title: Shed And Buried

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: The mysterious Mediterranean island of Malta lies south of Sicily and is home to megalithic structures built by a mysterious prehistoric society. Who were the people that built these sophisticated structures?

programme.title: The Search For The Tesla Files
programme.desc: The team investigates Nikola Teslas final residence, The New Yorker Hotel, and find incredible evidence that it served as much more than a home to the controversial inventor.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos, an expert on H2’s ‘Ancient Aliens’, is continually asked to visit sites and speak about the topics covered in the series. This show explores the possibility of a spin-off series, with Giorgio himself as the featured talent.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: Bob and John head to Northern Spain, where a declassified document shows Hitler could have moved there from Denmark. They discover several eye witnesses, a satellite of the Third Reich, and what could be a Nazi communications center.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: ‘Missing in Alaska’ investigates the region of northwest Alaska, where over 20,000 people have vanished in an area locals call the Alaska Triangle. In all these cases, the bodies are rarely discovered. Who or whats behind these cases is unknown.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: Closer than ever to the $200 million payday, Wayne and the team head into the heart of darkness where a cryptic find weaves an even bigger mystery.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: Historical clues and the expertise of geologists reveal how powerful forces shaped the planet.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: This mini-series looks into the history and beliefs behind religions that have shaped the universe. The show unearths alternative suggestions, poses questions and challenges the accepted, opening a whole new world on the history of the universe.

programme.title: Rome: Rise And Fall Of An Empire
programme.desc: In 450 AD, Rome is a mere shadow of its former self. Gone is the superior civilisation and great expanses of land. As a barbarian, Ricimer could not become Emperor. Yet he held all the power.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: In the closing months of WWII, legend has it that the Japanese buried something of immense value deep in the Philippine jungle. A group of investigators and engineers are using the latest technology to search for the treasure and the truth.

programme.title: Ancient Top 10
programme.desc: Ancient Top 10 is a smart, fun countdown that details how ancient technology worked, how surprisingly advanced it was, and how it was kind of awesome!

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: Investigate the facts and myths surrounding UFO sightings in every corner of the world. Examine evidence and eyewitness accounts and explore the mystery of what happened or what didnt happen.

programme.title: Missing In Alaska
programme.desc: Primate sightings in the Alaskan woods have the team puzzled, since experts say that monkeys have never lived in Alaska. The team investigates whether there could be a variety in the Alaska Triangle that is making meals out of men.

programme.title: Warriors
programme.desc: Japan, 1612: Legendary samurai Musashi meets arch rival Kojiro in a climactic duel. Modern-day warrior SFC Terry Schappert goes inside some of the most famous warrior cultures of all time to explore their weaponry, tactics and psyche.

programme.title: Food Tech
programme.desc: Nothing beats the taste of a Southern fried meal and Bobby traces its amazing journey to your plate. In Alabama, Bobby wades among 275,000 catfish during feeding time, and discovers how each fish scooped from the pond becomes a fillet within an hour.

programme.title: How The Earth Was Made
programme.desc: The Marianas Trench is the deepest place on earth. Follow a mission into the abyss and explore the geology that has created this deep scar along the ocean floor.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: With Peron toppled from power, Hitler and Bormann could have been forced to flee Argentina. Following leads from declassified files, Bob and John send their teams into Chile and Paraguay.

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: A range of geology, climatology and archaeology experts give their conclusions as to what life could be like on Earth if the human race dies out.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: In major cities around the world today, skyscrapers loom overhead, taxis honk their horns and street vendors peddle their wares. But below lies city upon city. ‘Cities of the Underworld’ explores this fascinating and unknown history.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: ‘The Universe’ examines how we know what we do about space; Mars, black holes and even if there is anywhere else out there that can sustain human life. This is the story of the scientists and explorers who dared to venture into uncharted territory.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: ‘Ancient Aliens’ examines 75 million years of the most credible alien evidence here on Earth, from the age of the dinosaurs to ancient Egypt to the skies over the western desert in present day USA.

programme.title: Battles BC
programme.desc: Discover how cornered Egyptian soldiers miraculously escaped the Hittites in one of the greatest armed battles of the ancient world.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Brad and the team hunt for the missing White House cornerstone, as well as a lost gun that could prove key to solving the infamous Amityville murders.

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: This episode features the most dramatic object in the collection – the stunning Knights Templar Sword that Carl and Hamilton believe might have been used at the infamous battle of Acre – the last stand of the Knights Templar in the Holy Land.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick reels in an antique glass fishing buoy made in Japan, he hopes the seller’s price floats his boat. Meanwhile, Chum checks out a rare dinosaur fossil. Can he dig up a good price, or will the seller have a bone to pick with him?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: In a pawn shop far away, Rick and Corey unbox a skateboard signed by Carrie Fisher. Then, Corey has a first-person encounter with “Halo: Combat Evolved.” Will he be the Master Chief of this deal? Chum is stunned by a vintage Versace collection.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: Ancient Astronaut theorists have long proposed that Earth is an extraterrestrial laboratory. If so, does it extend beyond humans into the animal kingdom? Accounts of animalist gods can be found across the globe that curiously mirror alien encounters.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: We humans want to boldly go into uncharted territories to make new discoveries. As the next era of space exploration begins, what will we find when we reach other planets? What dangers will we face when we try to conquer these new frontiers?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: This week, Rick, Corey, and Chum are hoping to strike it rich in the Mill City, Minneapolis, Minnesota. While there, the guys have a brush with a happy little Bob Ross painting, tackle a jersey signed by the Minnesota Vikings Purple People Eaters, and try to take home a prized vintage arcade collection. Later, the trio sink their teeth into some Juicy Lucys.

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When Ex-CIA agent Andy Bustamante and Investigative Journalist Paul Beban return to the ranch Robert Bigelow owned at the same time as Skinwalker, they encounter the same entity that drove Bigelow away and find evidence of what has been left behind.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While a trip to Europe continues to uncover clues connecting the Templars to Scandinavian culture and Oak Island, on Oak Island, a clue found beneath a Nolans Cross boulder may offer answers the team has been desperate for.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: All over the world, there are places and objects that are considered cursed. Many people avoid these places and things because they believe they will bring them misfortune. Others believe that curses are nothing more than superstition and folkloric legends. Are curses merely the product of an overactive imagination or the byproduct of eerie coincidences? Or is it possible that these curses are real—and that dark forces are at work that cannot be explained?

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While a trip abroad makes old world connections to the new world, on Oak Island, the team is thrilled when new evidence indicates that whoever was on Lot 5, was also deep in the Money Pit.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Human can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable. Is cheating death when survival is seemingly impossible simply fate or good fortune?

programme.desc: Andy and Paul deploy the largest piece of equipment theyve ever used to dig deeper into the mystery of the possible alien spacecraft buried in the lower meadow of Mt. Wilson ranch, but their investigation is threatened by mysterious interference.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While a trip abroad makes old world connections to the new world, on Oak Island, the team is thrilled when new evidence indicates that whoever was on Lot 5, was also deep in the Money Pit.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Human can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable. Is cheating death when survival is seemingly impossible simply fate or good fortune?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are ready to wrangle some wild deals in the Lone Star State. Along the way, the guys test-drive a 1968 Buick Riviera, become riveted by a blacksmiths anvil collection, and meet up with NFL legend, Emmitt Smith.

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are fishin for big deals in the Sunshine State! Between beach days and dinner with WWE superstar Titus ONeil, the gang is casting a wide net in St. Petersburg, Florida.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: In an all-UFO special, Tony Harris breaks down the latest developments and most compelling photographic evidence in a tumultuous year of UFO revelations. Did the most recent UAP incidents present a threat to national security?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A lone wolf prisoner, with aspirations of writing crime novels, ends up the star of his own break out story when he figures out how to escape from one of Mississippis oldest and most notorious prison farms, Parchman Penitentiary.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Escapes With Morgan Freeman
programme.desc: A German American pilot, Dieter Dengler, uses survival skills honed as a child to escape a secret prison in Laos in the early years of the Vietnam war.

programme.title: The UnXplained: Mysteries of the Universe
programme.desc: Earths moon is only one of hundreds in the solar system, each of them a mysterious and often bizarre world. Could alien moons offer a key to exploring outer space and perhaps even finding a new home for humanity?

programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum are making some revolutionary deals in Boston, Massachusetts. The guys have a wicked awesome visit as they check out a Patriotic painting, try their hand at rowing, and take aim at a Brown Bess musket from the 1700s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Times a-ticking when a seller brings a Mr. T wall clock to the shop; Rick checks out James Bonds credit card from the 2006 movie Casino Royale; Corey plays with an Atomic Cannon toy; Chum and Rick get down and dirty in Texas looking for fossils.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: This is the most mysterious of the Dead Sea Scrolls. An ancient treasure map, recorded on a rare Copper Scroll, could lead to billions of dollars of buried treasure in gold, in silver, in jewels. Where is the secret treasure of the Copper Scroll?

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The Tower of Babel, Sodom and Gomorrah, Mount Sinai are some of the greatest Old Testament stories ever told. Yet these iconic places have seemingly vanished from the map. Where are the Old Testament’s lost places--and what might they reveal?

programme.title: Pawn Stars Do America
programme.desc: Rick, Corey, and Chum rise from the ashes and start anew in Phoenix, Arizona. Along the way, Rick check out rare vintage Americana items, Chum checks out a mid-century furniture collection, and Corey gets in the ring for some boxing memorabilia.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is having fun on his swing. Back and forth he goes but suddenly it breaks! A disappointed Messy goes off go to Okido to find out why! He lands in Felix and Zoes garden but cant see them anywhere. To Messy’s surprise, out they jump from behind something strange… “Where did these metal trees come from?” Messy asks them and discovers that they arent trees, theyre legs! In fact, theyre legs of Stan Tall, Okidos biggest robot who is helping Zim build a bridge today. So Messy whistles the Okidoodle over and they race Stan to the seaside to get started!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero travel to Peru to take a marvellous spatuletail home. But what can they do when the hungry bird falls into a deep sleep?

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: The first time Samson came to Sodor he got lost. But Samson is a very proud engine and he doesn’t like to admit his mistakes. So he finds it very hard to listen to the other engines trying to warn him that he is making a mistake again when he accidentally takes Gordon’s Express Coaches to the quarry, instead of the trucks used for carrying stone.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Scruff breaks down and has to be sent to the Steamworks, Samson is given the job of collecting up the track-side scrap. But Samson ends up taking his new responsibilities a little too seriously and collects up everything from the postman’s bike to the Fat Controller’s car. The Fat Controller has to race off to save it before it ends up getting crunched by Reg’s claw!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles.
